result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alonzo Dashawn Bittner Madsen

records.addlTxt: DE called to confirm his court date.  Clerk advised DE he has a PTSC on 11-10-22 in RMW's court room. sm
22R 014760.   Posted by DE. olg
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on November 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Per SRN. fax: Discharge, Jail & SCSO. kma

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, County Market.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

1:26 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Alonzo Dashawn Bittner Madsen in court, in custody.  Attorney Abrianna Dolfi with Intern Lanie Krause in court for Alonzo Dashawn Bittner Madsen.  Prosecuting attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews file. Atty Krause has not had a chance to talk to DE.  DE to call PD's office to see if he qualifies. DE was picked up on his way to work. DE is on probation.  Court QUASHES WARRANT.  Bond argument.   Court orders bond and notes previously scheduled hearing. Adjourned at 1:29 PM. bph

DE called Clerk's Office asking if he had court today. Clerk informed DE that he had missed his hearing and a warrant had been issued. Clerk advised DE can write a letter to the Court asking to reset the case or turn himself in to SCSO to be seen in court. srb

1:32 PM CO: RMW, REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Lindabaur. Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jeremiah Harrelson in court for Defendant for today. Defendant Alonzo Dashawn Bittner Madsen appeared by video, in custody. DE updates address . DE understands charges and possible penalties. Waive reading. DE doesn't qualify for PD- PFAC given.
